alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 1:44PM MDT until May 07 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Wyoming... Salt River affecting Lincoln County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. Smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Salt River within Star Valley will continue to run near or above bankfull, and ponding of water in low-lying areas is likely through the weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Salt River near Etna. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Small creeks and streams that flow through the towns of Freeedom and Fairview are at bankfull. Minor flooding along low lying areas in Freedom and Fariview is occurring. At 5.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Monitor high water along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Etna. Small creeks and streams are flooding in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of ranchland/pastureland near Etna. At 5.5 feet, Flood stage. Low land flooding along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Etna. Low land flooding becomes more widespread upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of pastureland/ranchland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Salt River Etna 5.5 4.8 Thu 12 pm MD 5.2 4.8 4.5 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
